metadata.title: CVE-2012-4447 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in tif_pixarlog.c in LibTIFF before 4.0.3 allowsremote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) andpossibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted TIFF image using the PixarLogCompression format.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-4447` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.2-4ubuntu1
libtiff-tools - 4.0.2-4ubuntu1
libtiff5 - 4.0.2-4ubuntu1
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.2-4ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: tiff package in trusty/esm, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.0.2-4ubuntu1').
